cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles W of Cancun, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, then bending north-northwest toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwest Louisiana coast (between Vermilion Bay and Cameron, LA)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (watches expected later for northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Alabama, with greatest impact over Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (68% chance) of tropical-storm-force winds and a 23% chance of hurricane-force winds; strongest winds late Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft possible up the lower Mississippi River near the port if the center tracks just west of the river
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches Friday–Saturday, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible brief tornadoes and river flooding as heavy rain drains into the Mississippi system
